mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
Called whenever the user moves the mouse while a mouse button is held down. If the user is drawing, draw a line segment from the previous mouse location to the current mouse location, and set up prevX and prevY for the next call. Note that in case the user drags outside of the drawing area, the values of x and y are "clamped" to lie within this area. This avoids drawing on the color palette or Post button.

Specified by:
mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
This is called when the user presses the mouse anywhere in the applet. There are three possible responses, depending on where the user clicked: Change the current color, Post the drawing, or start drawing a curve. (Or do nothing if user clicks on the border.)

Specified by:
mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
Called whenever the user releases the mouse button. If the user was drawing a curve, the curve is done, so we should set drawing to false and get rid of the graphics context that we created to use during the drawing.

Specified by:
mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draw the contents of the panel. Since no information is saved about what the user has drawn, the user's drawing is erased whenever this routine is called.

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
